result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jacob Steven Krueger appeared by video.  Attorney Gregg H. Novack appeared by video for Jacob Steven Krueger.  Attorney Patrick J Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests resolution date.  Case adjourned to Branch 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Defense Counsel Request for Zoom Appearance, filed.

Defendant Jacob Steven Krueger appeared by video.  Attorney Gregg H. Novack in court for Jacob Steven Krueger.  Attorney Dennis Murphy in court on behalf of Patrick J Anderson for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense received discovery and no offer. Defense requests a status conference. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jacob Steven Krueger in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Defendant Jacob Steven Krueger in custody in Racine County.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Jacob Steven Krueger appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 11, Judge Swanson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 11.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver

Attorney Gregg H. Novack in court by video, defendant Jacob Steven Krueger not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present; witness is on an assignment out of county. Defense objects to an adjournment.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Court finds good cause to toll time limits as to the preliminary hearing.

Defendant Jacob Steven Krueger in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  After discussions with Attorney Novack and defendant.   Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Court amended the order appointing counsel and ordered the defendant to start paying the $175.00 as of August 1, 2022 and pay the 1st of each month until paid in full to convert to a civil judgment.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jacob Steven Krueger in court.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court conducted indigency hearing and appointed Attorney Gregg Novack to represent defendant at County expense and at the rate of $100/hour.  Court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $175.00/month commencing at the close of the case and on the 1st of the month until paid in full with authorization for repayment through civil judgment, tax intercept or wage assignment.  Appointment of Attorney at County Expense signed and filed.  Case is adjourned to Br. 25.  Case passed to allow defendant to consult with Attorney Gregg Novack.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court will review
JusticePoint Violation Report dated May 12, 2022 - received
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Violation Report 05-11-2022
Indigency hearing on June 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jacob Steven Krueger in court by video.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.  Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated May 2, 2022 - received

22RM021583  Actual Date Bond Posted with * Sheriff
4/24/2022

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $5,000.00.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.
No Contact Order signed and filed.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Greg A M, Jeaneen J M.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jacob Steven Krueger in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Jacob Steven Krueger in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jacob Steven Krueger appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2, 3, 4.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
